comment_text:
> One might argue that many beginner developers are using MySQL and that’s why the numbers are so high. Well, if you’ll look at the same chart but only for Professional Developers, the numbers look very similar.

Professional developers just mean they aren't a student. It doesn't mean any sort of experience level, especially experience level specifically with databases.

I'd argue that a significant amount of the user-base for MySQL comes from things like wordpress installs, especially where the developer is a beginner to databases.
